value.title: New way to compare Date and DateTime Value in Power BI - August 2021 Feature Summary
value.excerpt: Welcome to one more new update from Power BI Desktop. Sometimes we need to compare date or DateTime value in our DAX expression. At that time, we are using Date() function and Time() function. Now, there's one more easy way to compare Date and Time value in Power BI which is using "dt" keyword before

value.title: Power BI DAX for Beginners: AVERAGE, AVERAGEA, AVERAGEX
value.excerpt: Welcome to the complete Power BI DAX Beginner Series. During this session, we will discuss the AVERAGE function in DAX. AVERAGE function in Power BI DAX has lots of variations. During this session, we will cover AVERAGE, AVERAGEA, AVERAGEX. So, Let's get started!  The Episode covers the following information:

value.title: Power BI Tip - Hide Filter Pane From the Published Version of Power BI Report
value.excerpt: In this vlog we will learn about how we can hide the Filter Pane from the published version of the Power BI report. Sometimes there are situations in which we have set our Visual, Page or Report level filter as a part of development logic and we wish that end user should not able to change those values.

value.title: Power Query Tip - Add Sequential Number using the Index Column in Power BI

value.title: Relative Time Slicer in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this session, we will discuss the new feature rolled out during the April 2020 Update of Power BI Desktop.  Now, we can add  Time Slicer with the OOTB date filter in Power BI.   With Relative Time Slicer, we can filter data based on the time.  Sometimes there are situations, where we need to filter

value.title: Sort Legend in Power BI
value.excerpt: Welcome to Power BI Tips and Tricks Video. This is a short and sweet video demonstrating the functionality to apply Sort on Legend values in Power BI. value.title: 3 steps to pin Reporting Services visuals to a Power BI Dashboard

There are three main steps you have to do to get this to work.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube

This came up as I get pinged a lot from folks wondering how they can use AAD with Power BI, not necessarily realizing that it is already there.  http://blogs.technet.com/b/powerbisupport/archive/2015/09/15/azure-active-directory-and-power-bi.aspx
